arts.ttl: Lazio Goals Pour on Nice on Rainy Roman Evening
arts.sum: At the Stadio Olimpico in Rome, Lazio maintained their perfect Europa League record by beating Nice by four goals to one on a soaking pitch. Despite the heavy downpour, the Biancocelesti fans showed up in great numbers to warm up Marco Baroni’s men who responded with another convincing display in Europe. arts.ttl: Lazio’s Baroni praises team performance and Castellanos after Nice victory
arts.sum: Following Lazio’s impressive 4-1 win over Nice in the Europa League, manager Marco Baroni expressed his satisfaction with the team’s performance in the post-match press conference. Baroni began by commending his players’ interpretation of the game: “I’m happy for the boys, they interpreted the match well. I watched Nice’s last game, they’re a dangerous team. Now we need to recover quickly because we have Empoli coming up, but I’m happy for my fans.” The coach acknowledged the challenging conditions, particularly in the second half: “It’s a shame about the goal we conceded, but in the second half we quickly regained The post Lazio’s Baroni praises team performance and Castellanos after Nice victory appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Tottenham and Lazio stay perfect in Europa League with second straight wins
arts.sum: A youthful Tottenham side maintained a perfect record in the Europa League with a 2-1 victory away at Ferencváros on Thursday, while Lazio also made it two wins out of two by routing Nice 4-1 at home. Pape Sarr gave Tottenham the lead midway through the first half when he reacted quickly to a loose ball in the area and slotted it into the net with a right-foot shot for his second goal in two games in the second-tier European competition.

arts.ttl: Europa League | Lazio 4-1 Nice: Match Report
arts.sum: Lazio continued their impressive Europa League campaign with a convincing 4-1 victory over OGC Nice at the Stadio Olimpico. The match, played in increasingly difficult weather conditions, saw the Italian side showcase their attacking prowess and resilience. Pedro opened the scoring with a skillful finish from a tight angle, curling the ball into the far top corner after a corner kick situation. The lead was doubled by Taty Castellanos, who celebrated his birthday in style with a delicate chip over the onrushing goalkeeper.
